active_learning.discussion_prompt: In a group discussion, debate the cybersecurity risks of inadequate vendor termination notifications, using real-world examples like the SolarWinds supply chain breach. What preventive measures could have mitigated post-termination data exfiltration risks?
active_learning.peer_teaching: Explain the key concepts to a partner without using technical jargon.
active_learning.problem_solving: Given a scenario, apply the framework to solve the problem.

distractor_protocol.step: Identify common misconceptions about the topic
Ensure distractors are similar in length and complexity
Include partial truths that require deeper understanding

flashcard_generation.system_prompt: You are an expert flashcard generator for cybersecurity education, specializing in NIST-aligned content. Generate 50 high-quality flashcards on 'Vendor Termination Notification' (Topic Hierarchy: Cybersecurity > Security And Risk Management > Personnel Security > Third-Party and Contractor Personnel Security > Third-Party Compliance and Notification > Vendor Termination Notification). **Full Synthesized Content (Web-Grounded, Completed per NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5):** - **Foundation:** Vendor termination notification: Formal process to securely end vendor relationships, preventing risks like data exfiltration. Types: Normal (contract expiry), Adverse (breach/performance), Unfriendly (disputes/security incidents). - **NIST Controls:** SR-13 (Supplier Inventory: Maintain supplier lists, criteria, termination procedures including access revocation and asset return); SA-9 (External System Services: Agreements must specify termination rights, transition plans); PS-4 (Personnel Termination: For contractors – final security checks, NDA reminders); AC-2 (Account Management: Automate revocation). Aligns with NIST CSF ID.SC-4, RS.SC-2. - **Process:** 1. Contract review/notify (e.g., 30-90 days); 2. Revoke access; 3. Retrieve assets/data; 4. Audit/exit interview; 5. Document/update inventory; 6. Monitor post-term. - **Integration:** Supply chain risk (SolarWinds: Terminations revealed unmonitored access); Tools: Okta/SailPoint for auto-revoke; Legal: Data sovereignty. Checklist example: [Notify→Revoke→Retrieve→Audit→Close]. **Sources:** NIST SP 800-53r5 (https://doi.org/10.6028/NIST.SP.800-53r5); NIST CSF 2.0 (https://www.nist.gov/cyberframework); ISO 27001:2022 A.5.19/8.1.3; CISA Supply Chain Guidance (https://www.cisa.gov/supply-chain). **Pedagogy Integration:** - Learning Objectives: [insert the 6 objectives above]. - Scaffolding: Cover Layers 1-4 evenly. - Active Learning Tie-In: Flashcards support discussion (e.g., risk scenarios), peer quiz, problem-solving (step sequences). **Flashcard Generation Rules:** Follow exact schema: {type, front, back, explanation, distractors (array or null), bloom_level, scaffolding_layer, related_objective}. 60% Q/A/cloze, 40% MCQ (4 options, label correct). Distractors: Plausible errors (e.g., 'SR-13 is only for inventory, not termination'). Ensure progression: Layers 1-2 lower Bloom's, 3-4 higher. Varied difficulty. Output ONLY a JSON array of 50 flashcards: [{'type': '...', 'front': '...', ...}, ...]. No extra text.
